roles.name: Teacher / Instructor
roles.description: Delivers instructional content, assesses student learning, and fosters skill development across various subjects or grade levels.

meta.typicalBackground: Education degree, subject matter expertise, teaching certification, strong communication skills
challenges: Classroom management, diverse learning needs, technology access disparities

sampleUseCase.scenario: A high school science teacher implements hands-on labs and virtual simulations, increasing student engagement and test scores by illustrating real-world applications.

roles.name: Curriculum Developer
roles.description: Designs and updates educational materials, aligning content with standards and student learning objectives.

meta.typicalBackground: Educational research or subject matter expertise, familiarity with pedagogical best practices
challenges: Balancing academic rigor with practical relevance, ensuring inclusivity, iterative updates

sampleUseCase.scenario: A curriculum developer creates a STEM module for middle schoolers, integrating project-based lessons around renewable energy. This approach leads to higher interest in science fairs and club enrollments.

roles.name: Educational Technologist
roles.description: Implements and manages digital tools for learning, advises on tech integration strategies, and trains educators in digital pedagogy.

meta.typicalBackground: IT or education technology degree, knowledge of e-learning platforms, data privacy requirements
challenges: Teacher adoption resistance, digital equity (device/internet access), ongoing tech support demands

sampleUseCase.scenario: An educational technologist introduces a blended learning model using tablets and an online math tutorial system. They provide teacher training, track usage stats, and improve student math scores by 15% overall.

roles.name: School Administrator
roles.description: Oversees school operations, manages budgets, hires staff, ensures compliance with educational standards, and fosters a positive learning environment.

meta.typicalBackground: Experience in teaching and/or leadership, advanced degree in education administration
challenges: Resource allocation constraints, staff retention, meeting varied student needs, parental/community expectations

sampleUseCase.scenario: A principal introduces a mentorship program pairing new teachers with experienced ones, reducing turnover by 40% and improving overall teaching quality.

roles.name: Student Advisor
roles.description: Guides students academically and personally, helping them set goals, choose courses, and navigate career/college pathways.

meta.typicalBackground: Counseling or education degree, knowledge of college admissions, scholarships, or career counseling
challenges: Large student caseloads, family involvement, addressing emotional or socio-economic barriers

sampleUseCase.scenario: A student advisor helps a first-generation college applicant compile a strong scholarship application by aligning extracurriculars, academic achievements, and personal essays.
